result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Levi T Avenriep was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Levi T Avenriep is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Levi T Avenriep was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Levi T Avenriep was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent to Count 4.
Count 2 in Deferred Judgment of Conviction.
Court dismisses Count 1.
Defendant to report to Probation within 24 hours of this hearing.

  
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: to Count 4

DNA surcharge.

AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

Count 2 - all parties signed this date. c: DA. eif
c: Def & Atty. eif

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA:  Kenneth N. Sortedahl   DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea   DF:  Levi T Avenriep appeared.  Court called at 2:52 p.m.  Set for Motion Hearing.  State files a DJOC for Ct. 2.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty.   DE pleads Guilty to Ct. 2, Ct. 3 & Ct. 4.   Crt enters a Guilty plea for all three counts.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE adjudicated guilty of Cts 3 & 4. Crt accepts plea for Ct. 2 and stays the Guilty conviction upon the successful completion of the 36 month DJOC.  On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 1.  Attorneys make setencing arguments.  DE makes statement.    Crt orders:

Ct. 3 & Ct. 4 run concurrent
- S/W 2 years probation with conditions 
- AODA and follow through with any recommended treatment
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Court costs and the DNA surcharges for Ct. 3 & Ct. 4 totaling $886.00
- Court costs and DNA Surcharge to be paid from Forfeiture in 15CV168 
- DE to sign up for probation within 24 hours of this hearing

Ct. 2/DJOC
- Court agrees to the DJOC and orders the DE to follow the agreement
- Court approves the agreement and signs 
- Bail bond in 15CF87 is amended to a signature bond and will remain in effect for 36 months
- DE to sign up for probation within 24 hours of this hearing

-20 days to appeal
to Brian Avenriep ck# 024788 sent this date. eif
Motion hearing on July 16, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Amber L. Hahn, DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea   DF:  Levi T Avenriep appeared.  Court called at 9:34 a.m. Attorney Andrea advises the court he wants to set out for a Motion Hearing.  DE is asking the State to return items that were taken as evidence at the time of arrest.  State agrees to return the wallet, title to the vehicle and cell phone once the state can confirm that all the information was extracted from the phone.  Bail is continued.  Set out for Motion Hearings.  Court adjourned at 9:36 a.m. lw  Motion hearing scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on June 24, 2015 at 09:30 am.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Kenneth N. Sortedahl   DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea   DF:  Levi T Avenriep appeared.  Court called at 10:54 a.m.  Attorney Andrea advises the court there is an agreement.  Attorney Andrea is asking for time to address the money that was recovered at the time of DEs  arrest.  Continue the PTC.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned at 10:55 a.m. lw  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 20, 2015 at 10:30 am.

*AMENDED*

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Jennifer Anne Bork, DF ATTY: Alex Andrea, DF: Levi T Avenriep appeared.  Court called at 11:28 a.m.  Set for an arraignment.  DE has reviewed the Information.  Court informs DE of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands.  DE pleads Not Guilty on all counts.  Attorney Andrea argues bail.  Court amends the Bond from $1,000 cash bond to $500.  Return $500 of the the $1,000 bond to the payor.  Set out for PTC.  Court adjourned at 11:31 p.m. lw  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Notice of Motion and Motion to Suppress Statements, Notion of Motion to Suppress Evidence and Motion for Disclosure of Informand and Other Appropiate Releif, Memorandum in Suppoort of Discovery and Supplemental Discovery Motion, Supplemental Discovery Motion (1) and Motion to Suppress Evidence Resulting from Unauthorized Electronic Surveillance. Filed by Atty Andrea. km
Filed by ADA Hahn. km
Arraignment on April 27, 2015 at 11:30 am.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Alexis Mckinley, DF ATTY: Alex Andrea, DF: Levi T Avenriep appeared.  Court called at 2:48 p.m. Set for Preliminary Hearing.  Attorney Andrea advises the court the DE is waiving his right to a preliminary hearing.  Court questions the DE.  Court finds that DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives right to a preliminary hearing.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DE probably committed one and binds the DE over for trial.  Bail is continued.  Set out for arraignment.  Court adjourned at 2:52 p.m. lw  Arraignment scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 11:30 am.
Appointing Atty Andrea. km
Preliminary hearing on March 18, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

CO: EJL, RPR: Val Deiss, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:  Jennifer Anne Bork,  DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea,  DF:  Levi T Avenriep appeared. Court notes Defendant posted the bond.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  Defer entery of Counts 3 and 4 until after prelim. Prelim demanded. Bond continues in form and amount.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 02:30 pm. Back on record, Defendant's mother requests to have Defendant's DL back. They will go to NHPD.
